newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venezuela's Caldera plans no cabinet change-report.
newsitem.headline: Venezuela's Caldera plans no cabinet change-report.

text.p: Venezuela's President Rafael Caldera said he does not plan to change his cabinet of ministers for the time being although a shuffle could occur before the end of his term.
"At the moment I am not thinking about any change in the cabinet," Caldera said in a rare interview with leading daily El Universal published Thursday.
"But this does not mean, in my opinion, that all the ministers must stay until the end of the constitutional period," in February 1999, he added.
Caldera singled out Finance Minister Luis Raul Matos Azocar, Planning Minister Teodoro Petkoff and Trade and Industry Minister Freddy Rojas Parra for special praise.
The three ministers have been the main proponents of an economic reform package launched with the backing of the International Monetary Fund in April.

Caldera said that despite the harsh effects of the program -- which has pushed inflation to over 115 percent and sent the economy into recession -- there were signs that recovery was around the corner.
"I dare to think that the hope of a better life is beginning to reach Venezuelans," he said.
"We have shown that we are on the road to overcoming a tremendous crisis."
